title: Setting up OpenClaw: The Ultimate Personal Agent
summary: A comprehensive guide to installing, configuring, and deploying your own autonomous OpenClaw agent locally or on a VPS.
content:
OpenClaw is more than just a chatbotâ€”it's an operating system for agentic AI. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a fully functional agent running on your machine.

Prerequisites

  • Node.js v20+
  • A terminal (PowerShell, Bash, or Zsh)
  • API Keys (OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google)

Step 1: Installation

First, we need to install the OpenClaw core globally on your machine. Open your terminal and run:

npm install -g openclaw

Verify the installation by checking the version:

openclaw --version

Step 2: Initialization

Create a new workspace for your agent. This is where its memory and configuration will live.

mkdir my-agent
cd my-agent
openclaw init

You'll be prompted to select a template. Choose 'Personal Assistant' for a general-purpose agent.

Step 3: Configuration

Open the generated config.toml file. You need to add your LLM provider keys here.

[llm]
provider = "anthropic"
model = "claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620"
api_key = "sk-ant-..."

Step 4: Running the Agent

Launch your agent in interactive mode:

openclaw run

You should now see the OpenClaw banner and a prompt waiting for your command!

Pro Tip: Connecting to Telegram

To make your agent accessible from your phone, run the gateway service:

openclaw gateway connect --channel telegram --token YOUR_BOT_TOKEN

title: Integrating Gemini 1.5 Pro API
summary: Learn how to harness Google's massive 2M context window for document analysis and multimodal tasks.
content:
Google's Gemini 1.5 Pro offers an unprecedented 2 million token context window. This tutorial shows you how to build a simple script to analyze large PDF documents.

Step 1: Get an API Key

Head over to Google AI Studio and click 'Get API Key'.

Step 2: Project Setup

Initialize a new Node.js project and install the SDK:

mkdir gemini-analyzer
cd gemini-analyzer
npm init -y
npm install @google/generative-ai

Step 3: The Code

Create a file named analyze.js and paste the following code:

const { GoogleGenerativeAI } = require("@google/generative-ai");
const fs = require("fs");

// Access your API key as an environment variable
const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI(process.env.API_KEY);

async function run() {
  // For text-only input, use the gemini-pro model
  const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ model: "gemini-1.5-pro" });

  const prompt = "Summarize this document and find key action items.";
  
  // ... (Load file logic here)

  const result = await model.generateContent([prompt, ...fileParts]);
  const response = await result.response;
  const text = response.text();
  console.log(text);
}

run();

Step 4: Run It

Execute your script:

export API_KEY="your_key_here"
node analyze.js
